event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: If the FRU was inserted without following correct procedure, please use the correct procedure. Otherwise, schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A FRU's presence was unexpectedly detected. This may be caused by insertion of the FRU without following the correct procedure. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A FRU's presence detect signal was unexpectedly detected.

This may be caused by the insertion of the FRU without following the correct procedure.


This fault can occur due to the:

   Presence detect signal on a FRU suddenly appearing.

      Nothing is deconfigured and no immediate action is taken.
      The FRU that has been detected will not be configured into the system.


   FRU being inserted into the system without a "replacefru" or "addfru" operation.

      The newly detected FRU will not be configured into the system.


     SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

         The FRU that had its presence unexpectedly detected can be
         identified from the FMRI of the fault report. The following
         is a list of FRUs that have a presence detect signal:

            Power Supply Units (PSU);
           

      SPARC Enterprise M4000/M5000 platforms:

         The FRU that had its presence unexpectedly detected can be
         identified from the FMRI of the fault report. The following
         is a list of FRUs that have a presence detect signal:

            Power Supply Units (PSU);
            Fans (FAN_A or FAN_B).


      SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:

         The FRU that had its presence unexpectedly detected can be
         identified from the FMRI of the fault report. The following
         is a list of FRUs that have a presence detect signal:

            Fan tray (FAN_A or FAN_B);            
            DDC_A DDC Converter;
            CPU/Memory Unit (CMU);   
            IO Unit (IOU);
            Crossbar Unit (XBU);
            Clock Unit (CLKU).



   Please ensure that the "replacefru" or "addfru" command was executed before inserting the FRU.

      If there was no FRU inserted, then proceed with the steps outlined below.



The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the Fault Message  (two methods)


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:27:47 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: bc0ed9c9-ad41-41cd-96a4-1df57a05393c
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/ SCF-8004-KH for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8004-KH, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Minor
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:27:47 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: bc0ed9c9-ad41-41cd-96a4-1df57a05393c
   DESC: A FRU's presence was unexpectedly detected. This may be caused by insertion
   of the FRU without following the correct procedure. Please consult the detail section of the
   knowledge article for additional information.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8004-KH for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Nothing is deconfigured and no immediate action is taken. The FRU will not be
   configured into the system.
   IMPACT: None.
   REC-ACTION: If the FRU was inserted without following correct procedure, please use the
   correct procedure. Otherwise, schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field
   Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump  -v  -u  <Event-ID>' command
 

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u bc0ed9c9-ad41-41cd-96a4-1df57a05393c

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 15:27:47.3224 bc0ed9c9-ad41-41cd-96a4-1df57a05393c SCF-8004-KH
           100%  fault.chassis.device.inserted

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/psuif=0
                    Affects: -
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                             server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0/component=CHASSIS


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.


If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
response
event_registry_properties.item: Nothing is deconfigured and no immediate action is taken. The FRU will not be configured into the system.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: A FRU's presence was unexpectedly detected.
